title: The Church of Saint-Etienne-du-Mont
text: At one point, Meryon lived only a block away from the Church of Saint-Etienne-du-Mont, thus his familiarity with the surroundings may have helped him to chose this unique view.  A portion of the church's Renaissance facade is shown between the now demolished Collège de Montaigu and the corner of the Panthéon.
creditline:
The William M. Ladd Collection
Gift of Herschel V. Jones, 1916
